quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Frasier and Soap
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, profession. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: She played Cissy on 135+ episodes of Family Affair. Brian Keith played her Uncle and Sebastian Cabot played the butler/nanny.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kathy Garver

questions.question: How does Niles frequently describe the scent of Daphnes hair in the popular TV series Frasier?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cherry bark and almond

questions.question: At the end of the last season of the TV show Soap, a number of plot lines where left unresolved.  Which of these was not one of them?

options.text: Burt was about to walk into an ambush.
Chester was threatening to kill Danny.
Jodie was preparing for a sex change operation.
Jessica was facing execution by a firing squad.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jodie was preparing for a sex change operation.

questions.question: In what year did the sitcom Soap first hit the airwaves?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1977

questions.question: In an episode of the Frasier show titled Fool Me Once, Shame on You, Fool Me Twice..., during a particularly grumpy day, Frasier threatens Eddie by saying what?

options.text: You may bark now, but sleeping dogs tell no tales!
Im a humane man, but right now Id kick a kitten through an electric fan!
Your kibbles will soon be bits!
You didnt know this, Eddie, but I hid Hoffa, I can hide you!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Im a humane man, but right now Id kick a kitten through an electric fan!

questions.question: Why does Burt Campbell wind up in a mental hospital during the first season of Soap?

options.text: He thinks he is a little girl
He tries to kill his wife
He thinks he can make himself invisible

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He thinks he can make himself invisible

questions.question: This television comedy writer and producer, famous for creating The Golden Girls and Empty Nest, wrote or co-wrote all 93 episodes of Soap.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Susan Harris

questions.question: During what dance do Niles and Daphen create a stir among Seattles elite in the Frasier sitcom series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tango

questions.question: What actor played the gay character Jodie Dallas on the TV show Soap?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Crystal

questions.question: When Frasier from the sitcom of the same name hosts a benefit for the Seattle Theatre Ensemble, Niles asks a woman out. How does he describe her response?

options.text: Wild horses couldnt have driven her away more quickly.
She looked like a deer in headlights.
Her lips said no, but her eyes said read my lips.
She was as giddy as a schoolgirl waiting for a Donny Osmond autograph.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Her lips said no, but her eyes said read my lips.

questions.question: In the Frasier show, when Sam (Ted Danson) visits Frasier, how does he initially explain his trip to Seattle?

options.text: A local team needs a coach.
A friend is in the hospital.
Hes run away from his wedding.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A local team needs a coach.

questions.question: What was the former profession of Tim Flotsky, who married Corinne Tate in the TV series Soap?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: priest

questions.question: On the TV show Soap, Jessica and Marys father was an ex-military man who lived in a world where he was still fighting The War. What was his rank?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Major

questions.question: According to the Frasier series, where is Daphne from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manchester

questions.question: He was Bud Bundy on the sit-com  Married...with Children.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Faustino

questions.question: From the first episode to the last, the four stars of The Carol Burnett Show were Carol Burnett, Vickie Lawrence, Tim Conway and Harvey Korman.

questions.question: One of the best skits on The Carol Burnett show was about a secretary and her boss. Carol Burnett played the secretary, Mrs. Wiggens; Tim Conway played the part of her boss. What was that characters name?

questions.question: At the end of every Carol Burnett Show, what did Carol do after singing Im So Glad We Had This Time Together?

options.text: She took questions from the audience.
She pretended to hit a tennis ball.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She tugged on her ear.

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Hollywood Squares and Program
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, people, scoreboard. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The first person to be in the center square in the game show The Hollywood Squares was Ernest Borgnine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Only two people were on both the first and last episode of the original version of The Hollywood Squares. Who were they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter Marshall and Rose Marie

questions.question: This program had it all: money, sex, greed and big big shoulder pads. But Dallas ended the second season with a cliffhanger that became an international question. Who shot J.R.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kristin

questions.question: I shall not seek and I will not accept the nomination of my party as your president . What President made this startling announcement on March 31 1968?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lyndon Johnson

questions.question: On November 17, 1968 the New York Jets had taken the lead with 65 seconds left to play in a televised game between the New York Jets and the Oakland Raiders. 7:00 PM-time for a commercial break and the start of the regular scheduled program. To the rage of the Jets and Raiders fans, what program replaced the last 65 seconds of the Jets and Raiders game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heidi

questions.question: When did the original version of the show The Hollywood Squares air?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1966- 1981

questions.question: What was the original winning prize on the show The Hollywood Squares?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $200

questions.question: What Hollywood couple appeared together more than once on season one of HBO sitcom, Curb Your Enthusiasm?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ted Danson and Mary Steenburgen

questions.question: Do you believe in miracles? YES! Sportscaster Al Michaelss description summed up the play and excitement surrounding the USA Olympic hockey team at the 1980 games at Lake Placid. What team did the USA hockey team beat to take the gold at the 1980 Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Finland

questions.question: Who was the emcee of the show The Hollywood Squares?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter Marshall

questions.question: Lorne Michaels innovative idea of using comic talent from improvisational groups such Chicagos Second City and L.A.s The Groundlings made a success for NBCs new program Saturday Night. What comedian, famous for his seven words you cant say on television, was the first guest host?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Carlin

questions.question: The Madonna/Britney Spears kiss paled in comparison to this kiss bestowed on Americas best known bigot, Archie Bunker. Who kissed Archie Bunker on the count of three?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sammy Davis Jr.

questions.question: On the night of July 18, 1976 the scoreboard at the Montreal Olympics flashed 1.00. as a tiny Romanian gymnast, Nadia Comaneci, received the first perfect score ever given in Olympic history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: On August 29, 1967 the Narrator, William Conrad delivered the final line, Tuesday 29th, the day the running stopped. In what television show did the One Armed Man meet his fate in an abandoned amusement park?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fugitive

questions.question: How many episodes of the show The Hollywood Squares were filmed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Over 3,500
